result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (10th) and Operating w/ PAC (10th+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (10th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (10th+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Gary A. Armstrong was found guilty of OWI (10th), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The court has no objection to the defendant being eligible for work release privileges within the rules of the prison system.
Concurrent with: Any sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and may not be present upon the premises of any bars.
Defendant comply with any further terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any sentence currently being served.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
Information for Defendants After Felony Conviction - Warning not to Possess Firearms

Case called @ 10:33 a.m. Defendant Gary A. Armstrong in court with attorney Max Wayne Saylor.  Defendant Gary A. Armstrong in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Complaint stated. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed by DA Blader. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. 14TR1557 & 14TR1558 - DRI. The defendant has waived his right to a PSI. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the PSI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Saylor. Statement by DE.

Court orders: 123 mos term of imprisonment - Bifurcated SEH - 63 mos IC/60 mos ES - concurrent with the sentence currently being served - 94 days CFTS. ES Conditions:  AODA and follow through, Abs Sob, Not be on the premises of any bars, defendant to maintain gainful employment, 36 mos DL rev/ 36 mos IID, Any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, OWI Assessment, $2500 fine inclusive of costs - Costs to be paid from up to 25% of inmate earnings during IC. The court has no objection to the defendant being eligible for work release privileges within the rules of the prison system. Defendant is not eligible for CIP. Defendant is eligible for SAP. Appeal rights given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 11:04 AM: Defendant Gary A Armstrong in court with attorney J Steven Heil for Max Wayne Saylor.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Atty Heil argues as to Def's debit card currently in jail possession.  No objection by the State.  Court directs that Def receive access to his finances so as to allow retainer fee to get paid.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 09:05 am.
Initial appearance on August 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

Case called @ 1:15 p.m. Defendant Gary A Armstrong in court, in custody, appears via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant wishes to have an attorney but does not qualify for SPD services. The court will expect that the defendant will privately retain counsel. DA Blader requesting $5000 Cash Bond. No statement by the defendant regarding bond. Court orders $5000 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.
